page.title: 15 - INDUSTRY AND COMMERCE
page.content:
There is very little industry and commercial enterprise in the area because of its rural nature. What little there is, came into existance before local authority planning regulations existed, and would never be allowed to start up today.
The sandpits at Heathend and Coates are the only viable non-agricultural businesses. Because the sand lorries have to be weighed there is a weighbridge that is also available to the public.
A builders merchant operates from the same premises as the Sandpits, but only provides a retail service, since all the goods that are sold are bought in from the actual manufacturers.
